message.content:
Based on the provided VIT MSW brochure, here are the key points regarding eligibility and admission procedure for the Master of Social Work (MSW) program:

**Eligibility:**
- Any graduation with at least 60% marks (including all subjects) from a recognized university or institution.
- The duration of graduation should be a minimum of three years.
- Eligibility for relaxation in qualifying examination marks is provided for SC/ST community applicants and those from Jammu & Kashmir, Ladakh, and North Eastern States.
- Applicants from correspondence/open university mode are not eligible.

**Tuition Fee:**
- A caution deposit of Rs. 2,000/- (refundable) is required along with the tuition fee of Rs. 60,000/- (per annum).

**Application Procedure:**
- Online application is mandatory, with a non-refundable application fee of Rs. 600/- (Rupees six hundred only).
- Scanned copies of all documents with photo and signature are required to be uploaded.
- Incomplete applications will not be considered.

**Admission Procedure:**
- Admission is based on performance in the qualifying examination (U.G. Degree).
- Candidates will be called for a Personal Interview in the order of merit based on U.G. marks.

**Documents Required at the Time of Admission:**
- Originals: Check List, four passport-size color photographs, Transfer/Migration/College Leaving Certificate, Student Profile, Physical Fitness Certificate, Affidavits (signed by the student and parent in Rs.20/- Stamp Paper).
- Photocopies: X and XII Std. Marks statement, Mark Sheets of all semesters, Qualifying Degree/Provisional Certificate, Community Certificate (for SC/ST categories), Conduct Certificate, Provisional Admission letter, Admission First year Fee receipt, Nativity Certificate.

**Important Notes:**
- University Registration Number will be generated only after submission of the above documents.
- Candidates must produce final year marks and provisional degree certificate by 15th August 2024, or their admission will be cancelled with the forfeit of admission fee.

For more detailed information, please refer to the VIT MSW brochure or visit the official VIT website (www.vit.ac.in).
